characters: -INTERCUT LESTER AND LEON TALKING ON THE PHONE
ELSEWHERE ON THE USED CAR LOT
EXT. REAR OF FAST FOOD PLACE

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Begin Credits:

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR AN L.A. STREET
dialogues.text: A beat-up, egg-shell Porsche brakes at a stop light besid immaculate red Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PORSCHE
dialogues.text: is PETE GENTRY. He's give-a-damn good-looking, maybe 33, well-built. There is something special about Gentry. Mayb it's the careless way he holds the wheel. Maybe it's the scratched-up leather jacket or the haircut one week past neat. Or maybe it's something secret and hidden and waiti to explode. Whatever it is, it's there in spades. Gentry's vision trails over to the car idling beside him, red Ferrari. Gentry casually takes in the car, then the driver, a silk-and-designer-jeans Hollywood type, who fir recognizes Gentry's existence with an expression of disda then a grin of anticipation. Gentry returns his eyes to t stop light before gently easing the ancient Porsche into first. A race. Moments pass. Light still red. More moments. Green light. The Ferrari roars off the line ahead of the Porsche. Gent corrects an early fish-tail, shifts into second. Third. T cars are bumper-and-bumper. Fourth. Porsche pulling ahead Fifth. The Ferrari is falling behind. Shitty driver. The Ferrari brakes and executes a sharp left in shame. St powering forward, Gentry grins. A moment later an LAPD black-and-white pulls in behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cops, VET and ROOKIE.

dialogues.speaker: VET
dialogues.text: Okay, let's take him. Lights and siren go on.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry sees the black-and-white's flashing lights behind He reaches over, removes a small detachable roof lamp fro the glove compartment and plugs it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vet and Rookie watch as Gentry's flashing detachable lamp secured to the top of his Porsche via a magnet base. The Porsche accelerates away.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE
dialogues.text: Hey! But Vet has already shut off the black-and-white's siren flashing roof lights.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE
dialogues.text: He's getting away!

dialogues.speaker: VET
dialogues.text: I've seen that kind of action before. He's a hot-shot detective. Probably vice or homicide. And he'd love us to pull him over. I won't give him the pleasure. End credits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour after sunrise. A lonely jogger pounds up the sand A moment after sand has stopped cascading into his footprints, a woman walks from the sea. Her beauty is arresting and uncalculated. ADRIENNE. Nearby, a house, a cool two million five if it's a dime. huge two-story window fronts the sea, and below, a deck a exterior staircase. Retrieving a towel from the sand, Adrienne makes for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne lets herself in via the sliding door. The place chic and expensive. She ascends the steps to the second floor.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUGLAS ERICKSEN, 40, a self-made man whose single preten is that he has none, tosses a leather suitcase onto the b Bare-chested, he intends to pack and dress at the same ti Adrienne enters and moves for the bathroom, unsnapping an removing the bikini top as she goes. Douglas pulls on a beige business shirt, buttons the fron starts on the cuffs when Adrienne, wearing nothing but a towel bunched in front of her, steps into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Douglas? Adrienne smiles alluringly. She is the most beautiful, naked, juicy woman imaginable. But Douglas is a tough guy

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) You'll make me late for my plane.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Then hurry home. Yes. He will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douglas places his bags in the trunk of his Mercedes. Adrienne watches nearby. He stops at the car door and loo at her a long moment before:

dialogues.speaker: DOUGLAS
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. Douglas pulls her into an embrace. Gentle, he nonetheless lifts her up to meet him. Their lips linger before:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. Douglas slides behind the wheel and a moment later the Mercedes backs out of the driveway and motors south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne leans against the rail nursing a drink.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 4. The wash of the sea is an endless noise. Up and down Tran Beach few house lights are lit. She could be the only per for miles. Finishing the drink, Adrienne gives the night one final l before entering the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne slides the door closed and locks it. A moment later she checks the front door. It's locked too A moment after that, she stops at the staircase long enou to shut off the television with the remote before tossing to the couch and ascending the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne slips beneath the covers, then reaches for the bedside lamp. An instant later her eyes are high-lighted moonlight sliced by blinds. She closes her eyes. An effor

dialogues.speaker: SOME TIME LATER
dialogues.text: Adrienne jerks at an almost imperceptible noise from belo She reaches for the bedside lamp, then reconsiders. Risin from the bed, she grabs a robe, pulls it on, and then sta perfectly still, listening. Nothing. She is almost ready to dismiss the whole thing when she h a noise. Distantly. From below. Adrienne tip-toes to the door, turns the knob, slowly pul it open. It starts to creak. She freezes. Shit! Nudging it open but a little, the door creaks again. No escaping noise, Adrienne gently opens the door wide enough to slip through.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY AND STAIRS
dialogues.text: opens a hallway cabinet, withdraws a flashlight but does turn it on. She stands perfectly still, listening. Nothin She tip-toes to the stairs, begins to descend. A thud followed by the sound of shattering porcelain. Adrienne freezes and listens, but hears nothing. Pounding heart. Blood pulsating through her veins. Someone could b down there.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 5. The flashlight beam flits out and down the staircase, mak ordinary reality out of the darkness far below: A chair l The drapes. A painting. Moments later:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Is there someone there? Another noise. Close. Near the bottom of the stairs. Adrienne gasps, then whips the heavy flashlight around, swinging it from place to place. The shafting beam catche nothing. Adrienne steels herself and descends.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: reaches floor-level and sweeps the light across the mass oblong shapes that briefly become her furniture before ag being swallowed by darkness. She advances to the sliding glass door, checks that it is locked again, then turns. As she does, the flashlight catches something slashing toward her! She jumps back... only to discover that it's a shadow created by the flashl in her hand. Adrienne calms herself -- before a noise wrenches her around. She swings the light.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Who's there? Who's there?! Something leaps from the darkness and lands nearby. Adrie brings the beam to bear on... Buttermilk, her startled Siamese cat, whose diamond eyes glow in the dark. Sagging, Adrienne laughs at her own fright. She reaches o to the animal and it gladly moves into her arms. As she p the cat:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Buttermilk! Jesus! You nearly scared me to death! Behind Adrienne is a glass wall before the ocean. The fac then torso of a man rises from the beach and approaches. Adrienne moves away, still petting the cat.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: If you broke any of my china, that's it for you, kid. She turns around just as the intruder drops out of sight.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 6.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (Buttermilk) Do you hear, hmmm? Do you hear? Turning again, Adrienne cannot see the intruder approach glass. His face looks gruesome, as if melted in a fire. Then it becomes clear. He's wearing a stocking. Adrienne cuddles Buttermilk to her cheek lovingly. She do on this animal. At the window now, the intruder's face presses against th glass. He stares down at her. His gloved hands flex in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Let's put us to bed, hm? Adrienne stands. Buttermilk sees the intruder and howls i fright before clawing Adrienne in its desire for flight. Adrienne releases Buttermilk.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Ow! Buttermilk! What's wrong with you?! She turns and sees the intruder beyond the glass. Adrienn screams. The intruder picks up a deck chair and throws it through window, which shatters into a thousand splinters. Adrienne retreats to the stairs as the intruder leaps thr the gaping hole in the glass and pursues.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No! No! NNNnnnoooooo0o!

dialogues.speaker: STAIRS
dialogues.text: One gloved hand grabs her ankle. Another draws the blade whose jagged edge glints from some unknown light. Adrienn kicks, crawling backward up the stairs, before throwing t heavy flashlight, catching the intruder in the face. A second is bought and Adrienne spends it separating hersel two feet, three, four -- from the intruder before spinnin run. But his hands grope for her, missing her heels by inches as she ascends the stairs. Adrienne hears the intruder's foot-fall behind her as she reaches the bedroom doorway and through, slamming the doo behind her.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne locks the door and retreats a step as something someone -- slams into it.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No! No! I'll give you money! Just go away! Please go away! The sound changes. Before a shoulder blow, now it is made a boot. Adrienne flinches each time the noise impacts and retreat behind the bed. She grabs the phone. No dial tone. Adrienne lurches for something in the darkness as the jam begins to splinter. An instant later the intruder bursts through the door and leaps at her. Adrienne spins and fle as the intruder's blade seeks her flesh. Suddenly a BANG! and a brilliant burst of light. Another. Another. Muzzle flashes capture the intruder in a sequenc of still-lifes as he's thrown back across the room. Six portraits. Then darkness. Adrienne lies sobbing on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Adrienne crawls to a wall switch and light fills the room She stands, finally, and looks at the hooded man who lies a pool of his own blood across the room. Adrienne approaches the body and leans close. Her hand reaches out and pauses inches from the stocking. Then in brief, brave instant she yanks the mask clear, exposing t dead face of: Her husband. Douglas Ericksen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne, her face tear-streaked, sits in a chair across room from the body, which is now being loaded onto a gurn by two white-coated attendants. Several uniformed LAPD officers stand nearby talking casually. Closer, a man sits on the bed near Adrienne. The beat-up Porsche driver. LAPD Detective Sergeant Pete Gentry.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 8.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What then? But Adrienne has lapsed into never-never land. Gently:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What did you do after you discovered it was your husband? Just outside the bedroom door, DETECTIVE LEON KESSLER, 55 burly knot of a man wearing more traditional cop clothes, wrinkled sport combo and tie, finishes taking a statement from JOANNE PETERS, an attractive woman Adrienne's age, a enters the room jotting notes down on a small spiral-boun tablet.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I... went downstairs, but that phone isn't working either. (stops; almost loses control) Then I ran I ran to Joanne Peters house. It's the next one down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (gently) Mrs. Ericksen, did you have any idea that your husband wanted to kill you? The very mention of it almost makes her reject it. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No! I love... loved him. I thought he loved me. She can't deny a look at the sheet-covered body of her de husband as it's wheeled out of the room. Then she buries head in her hands and sobs gently. Gentry, obviously sympathetic, is helpless. Leon sits down on the bed. Adrienne bobs, adjusting to hi weight. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen, I gotta be honest with you. Something bothers me here. You say your husband left on a business trip to San Francisco this morning. Then he comes back here tonight, breaks in, and tries to murder you with a knife. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deceptions by Richard Taylor 9. LEON (cont'd) And yet he forgets that he left his -357 Magnum revolver in the bedside table drawer. That seems... what, Pete? Inconsistent?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: What are you implying?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I'm not implying anything, lady. All I'm trying to say is...

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You're saying I wanted to kill my husband? You're saying -- (more hysterical) You're saying I wanted to kill-- Gentry shoots his partner an angry look. He reaches out, touches Adrienne's arm.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen, it's okay! We can continue this tomorrow when... (another angry look at Leon) when you're feeling up to it. But Adrienne cannot hold back the torrent of rage, pain a tears.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Well, let me tell you, Officer, my husband didn't know it was there! It was in the shop being repaired. I picked it up last week and forgot to tell him about it! Joanne Peters, seeing Adrienne's mental state from the doorway, enters the room and rushes to Adrienne's side.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: Addie, are you okay? Joanne wraps her in protective arms, trying to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (reality sinking in) Forgot... Forgot to tell him.. Forgot... Adrienne collapses into sobs. Joanne's angry stare sears into Gentry a moment before he turns to Leon and gestures Outside. Leon sighs and exits as Gentry rises:  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 10.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen, we can finish taking your statement tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: exit the bedroom and descend the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Nice going, Leon.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I'm not in the comfort business. I'm in the truth business.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You're not going to gain anything by turning her into a hostile witness.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: If she's guilty, she's already hostile. Just ask her husband. He glares at Gentry. Gentry glares back. Then he grins. These guys have been sparring for years. There's a faceti cynicism to their banter.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I think she did it.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You think everybody did it.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Everybody did do it. They just aint been caught.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Got it figured, huh?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Well, I dunno, Pete. Maybe he left the gun in the drawer because he was fair-minded and wanted to give her a fighting chance. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I think I'll keep an open mind.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You gotta watch that. Who knows what'll blow through there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry and Leon exit and move for the side of the house. neighbors are busy pounding a sheet of plywood over the h made by the intruder. Farther along the side of the house wire junction box.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Here's where the wires were cut. All of the various lines come into the house at this point. Cable. Security. Phone. He knew which ones to cut. Hell, it was his house, wasn't it? Severed wires hang from the junction box.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! Slow down! I thought you said she did it? Now you're telling me the husband planned the whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I'm not telling you anything. But ask yourself one question. That girl's a walking wet-dream. Why would anyone want to put an end to something that sweet?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You're right. She's too pretty to be innocent. Let's fry her.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Okay. You've got my opinion. So what's yours? Really.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I think she's one hot-looking woman with a lot of money and a lot of time to enjoy it. (grin) Just my type.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: She's your type, all right. She just offed her husband.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 12.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: At least she's single.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Oh Jesus, I gotta go home. You're making me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry follows Leon out the rear gate. Leon moves for his unmarked police cruiser and a moment later its engine fir Leon throws Gentry a wave and backs the car out. Gentry stops beside his Porsche and digs for the keys. Something captures his attention: A large window in the Ericksen guest bedroom. Adrienne st and stares off into space. A moment later she removes the robe and stands nude and beautiful before the glass. Finally, she moves away. Gentry stands frozen, unable to move. Adrienne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ride with Gentry as he steers the Porsche southward on Th Coast Highway toward the city. Gentry pushes the car fast and faster. Thoughts. Thoughts on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry steers the Porsche into his normal "spot" near the entrance to the three-story building, exits, moves for th front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry has his key in the lock when the door to the next apartment opens and LINDA, 26 and a looker, leans out. Seeing it's Gentry, she slips out into the hall. A short robe conceals almost nothing.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: (whispering) Pete...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 13.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: I got back into town early. Our radar went haywire over Denver and we're on the ground 'til it's fixed. Gentry grins. He knows Linda very well and is happy to se her. He takes her into his arms and is about to kiss her she pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: I left a message on your machine... Pete, I'd invite you in, but... I have a friend staying over. As if introduced, the door opens and her FRIEND takes a s into the hall. He's one sweat-stained muscle. He wears a towel. Nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA'S FRIEND
dialogues.text: Hey, Linda, where'd ya go? Linda's Friend takes one look at Gentry's hands on his gi and frowns. Linda writhes free.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: (faking it) Tomorrow. And I'd really appreciate it, Pete. (to Friend) Pete's my neighbor. He's going to give me a hand tomorrow with some -- Disgusted, Gentry enters his apartment before she can fin explaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neat it isn't. Nor homey. Nor telling of the man who live here. Its lack of permanence is a statement itself. Gentry exits the bathroom wearing a robe. He pours himsel two fingers of liquor and drops onto the bed. He sips the whiskey. A sound. From the apartment next door. A pounding noise. Rhythmic. Linda's bed hitting the wall. And then another noise. A woman's voice. Linda's. Ecstasy. Gentry sips. Thinks.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: Deceptions by Richard Taylor 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8x10 glossies drop to a table top. Each is of Douglas Ericksen. Dead. Mask half-pulled off. Bullet holes and blood everywhere. Gentry, holding a phone to his ear and eating idly froma huge pastry, drops the last photo and stares at them, thinking. Leon enters with a cup of steaming water and takes one so look at Gentry's pastry before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (irritated) What? What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Chemicals. They got chemicals in that doughnut that could preserve a fart. Leon sits behind his desk, pulls out a tin of herb tea, begins preparing his morning ritual.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Leon, you're thirty pounds overweight.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Yeah, but they're good pounds. No chemicals. No junk. Gentry's expression says, Oh, Jeez.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (phone) Hello? No, that's okay. I'mon city time... Well, thanks. We appreciate the cooperation. (hangs up; referring to notes) Douglas Ericksen checked into the Mark Hopkins at 10:30 yesterday morning. No one at the desk can identify him, but he used a credit card and signed both the receipt and the desk register.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 15.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: What about his stuff?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It's still there. That was a San Francisco PD detective named Larson. He just inventoried everything in Ericksen's room.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: nis if saying, "Go on.") Yeah? So?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: More notable for what wasn't found. No receipt for a second set of airline tickets. Just Ericksen's bags filled with clothes. His appointment book. This perks Leon up.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Yeah? What about -- ?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Already checked. No San Francisco appointments penned in. No San Francisco numbers or contacts, either. Leon considers that a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: That just doesn't figure. Guy plans on killing his wife, he'd be sure to make the alibi look good. Grabbing his coat off the back of a chair:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: The appointment book doesn't prove anything. Maybe he was a bad record-keeper.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Sure. That's how he got rich.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 16.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Okay, one of us has to check the airport for his car and travel reservations, and one of us has to go back out to the beach and finish taking Mrs. Ericksen's statement. Which do you want?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I have a choice, right? Gentry grins. Sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's Porsche pulls into the driveway and Gentry exits moves for the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry pushes the street gate open and paces down the wal siding the house to the door. He taps on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen! Mrs. Ericksen! No answer. There's a sheet of paper folded and taped to t door. He flips it up and reads: Glass installers: I'll be back soon. Please get the job started. Adrienne Ericksen. Gentry pushes the door. It swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry enters, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen? Again, no answer. He ascends the steps and a moment later descends them. The billowing drape tells him the deck door is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry steps outside. A moment later he's leaning on the rail, allowing the wind to caress him. His body language seems to say, God, I could get used to this! Then he sees Adrienne running from the sea. She wears a skimpy bikini, her hair tussled and sexy. She moves up the beach and doesn't notice the man standing on her deck until she is way up the steps.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 17.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Ooh!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Didn't mean to startle you. Gentry's can't help himself. He's taking in every inch of her. Adrienne attempts to break the spell she's cast on Gentry continuing up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I often take a swim in the morning. The beach is lonely then and the water cool.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Nice. To be able to do that, I mean. She has stopped not two feet from him and he's doing a terrible job of hiding his lust. She inches closer, then:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You're blocking my way. To the door. Stepping out of the way:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. He follows her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry watches Adrienne cross the living room to a closet where a short terricloth robe hangs. She pulls it on, tur before his sight can rise. She cinches the robe with finality.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I'm flattered, Sergeant. Under happier circumstances, I would be very flattered. Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Something?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 18.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: To drink? (moving to kitchen) No. You're a cop and you're on duty, so you don't drink. Well, I need a drink. She finds a bottle in a cupboard, reaches up to get it. Gentry watches the robe ride up her long, lovely legs.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Bourbon. Surprised, she looks over her shoulder at him, then pours several fingers of Bourbon into a water glass, drops in i

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (giving him drink) I'm... trying to adjust my thinking. Trying to see things the way they are. It's funny. The world doesn't look any different.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (gesturing plywood) You seem to be doing okay. You've already arranged for the glass to be replaced. Leading him into the living room area:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Oh, that. Joanne made the arrangements this morning. She's been very supportive.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Did you spend the night here?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (with difficulty) Yes. In the guest bedroom. I couldn't... stay in there. With Douglas's blood on the carpet, I mean. It's like... part of him is still up there. Seeing her pain, Gentry takes a gulp of his drink and shi gears.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 19.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (opening notebook) Mrs. Ericksen, I need to finish taking your statement. For our report.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Certainly. I'll cooperate any way I can.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You said last night that your husband's gun had only recently come back from the gunsmith's. When was that?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: A couple of weeks. I don't remember the exact date. There's an invoice around here somewhere. (rising) I can get it --

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Not necessary. I just need a name.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Santa Monica Gun and Rail. Something like that. It's on Lincoln Boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: The owner called you?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I imagine he's the owner.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: He called you?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Yes. Is that important?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Well, it tends to substantiate that the gun was in the drawer by circumstance. The time and date of its return was not under your control.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Why is that important?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 20.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It suggests there wasn't premeditation involved in your husband's death. Adrienne's eyes bore into him. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: That man last night. That police officer...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Detective Kessler.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I thought he was... just an ugly little man. I didn't take him seriously. I'm under suspicion for ~‚Äù

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: All possibilities are considered in a homicide investigation. Adrienne flinches at the word homicide and turns her eyes away. When again she looks at Gentry, her eyes are red an tear-filled.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I loved my husband, Sergeant. I loved him... passionately. If he hadn't been wearing a mask, I don't think I could have... pulled the trigger. Tears roll down her cheeks. She is fighting to retain control of herself. Gentry is silenced by her emotions. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen, I've got to cover this territory. She gestures a mute consent.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: How was your husband's business going? Were there financial problems?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 21. Adrienne straightens, gains control over herself. These a every-day matters.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: My husband was a financial advisor. He always made a good income. As far as I know, everything was fine.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: He didn't bring his work home with him?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. Douglas kept work and home separate. When he worked, he worked hard. When he played, well... He never talked business.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I'll need a business address.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Three eleven Hauser. That's in Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (jotting down address) Did you and your husband have a death benefit insurance policy?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Yes. He keeps... kept all of our important papers in the floor safe at his office. It's a substantial sum. I don't recall the amount. I saw it for all of five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Do you have the combination to your husband's safe?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. The subject just never came up. Douglas took care of me. He was that kind of man. Gentry pauses, gauging her durability before asking:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Did you ever suspect there might be another woman? The pain of the question rolls across her expression.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 22.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. Never.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Is it possible he could have been seeing someone and you not know about it?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so... (tearful) Sergeant, I don't know what to believe about my husband. Not anymore. Gentry leans close.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen, the best possible scenario we can make of this is that your husband attempted to murder you in cold blood. He did that for some reason. You've got to help me find that reason. Adrienne writhes with the question, shaking, tears cascad down her cheeks as her mind questions everything her marr life has been up until this moment.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I don't know! I don't know! (sobbing) I don't know-I don't know-I don't know... why my husband didn't love me! She collapses into herself, burying her head in her arms. Gentry struggles with himself. His professionalism dictat that he retain distance. And yet... Gentry rises, crosses to the couch, lays a hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen, is there anything I can -- Adrienne turns and buries herself in Gentry's arms. Startled, Gentry pulls her into an embrace. His hand reac out to stroke her hair, but stops inches from contact. Sensing his awkwardness, she looks up. Their eyes connect Each realizes desire for the other. Finally, she pulls aw  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 23.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (straightening) I'm sorry. I shouldn't act like... Shaky, she turns away. Gentry reaches out to steady her.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. Actually, I have a prescription. Something to calm me down.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You've seen your doctor since last night? Adrienne pulls away, begins to move for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. I take them for... I get depressed, sometimes. Sergeant, I'm sorry, but they usually make me sleep. Perhaps tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Sure. Tomorrow. Gentry watches as she ascends the stairs. A part of him wants to follow her. He hears the door upstairs close bef turning and moving for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry and Leon at the counter. Gentry looks troubled.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (to counter girl) Coffee. That's it. As the counter girl rings up Gentry's order:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Jesus, what's the matter with you? This is the perfect opportunity to load up on empty calories.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Not hungry, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: That's sixty-five.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 24. Gentry gives her a five. As she makes change:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: So what did you find out?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) If there's another woman, she doesn't know about her. She also says that as far as she knows her husband's business was doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Insurance policy?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Joint survivor's benefit. She says it's substantial. She doesn't recall the exact amount.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Ha! I believe that!

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: (counting change) Seventy-five, a dollar, two, three, four, and five. (Leon) Sir?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I don't know. You got anything other than crap?

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: (insulted) I'm sorry, sir?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You know. Grease. You got anything that doesn't have grease in it? Like maybe a salad?

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: No, we don't have salads, sir. We have a chicken sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: How's it prepared? Gentry is beginning to look like he doesn't know this guy  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 25.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Is it deep-fried in oil? Is it fried on a grill? Is it --

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: It's micro-waved.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Micro-waved? !

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: It comes frozen, sir!

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Oh, never mind. Give me a B-L-T, hold the B, hold the mayo, on sourdough toast. And herb tea.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: Herb tea?

dialogues.speaker: AT A TABLE
dialogues.text: eat lunch.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: How 'bout you?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Ericksen checked his Mercedes in at the airport garage at nine o'clock. It's still there. (sniffing sandwich) They put mayo on this. I can smell

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Leon, how did he get to his house?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: -- it. I hate... What?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: How did Ericksen get to his house last night? His car was parked at LAX.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Maybe he rented a car.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 26.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Or someone drove him. Leon grins.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Like a girlfriend, right? Which gives him a motive for killing his wife. Jesus, isn't this cute? You're trying to clear the girl, aren't you, Gentry? You're thinking with your glands. Has it ever occurred to you -- maybe she has a boyfriend? Maybe he flew to San Francisco. Maybe he left Ericksen's car at LAX.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Maybe the Pope's a communist.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hell, for all I know, he is!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (rising) Okay, you take the car rental agencies at LAX. I'll check with the cab companies.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. Back to LAX. The traffic's awful...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (rising) I'll meet you at Ericksen's office at four. (jotting down address) Here's the address. Gentry turns, but something happening at the counter stil him: Two latinos, obviously gang members wearing their "colors divide just inside the door. One pulls a sawed-off shotgu from beneath a jacket and aims it toward the eaters. The second bares a handgun and leaps the counter to begin emptying cash registers.

dialogues.speaker: HANDGUN
dialogues.text: (to register girl) Back off, bitch!  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 27. He gives her a shove. She collides with the stove and bur her arm. Handgun pays her no mind. Shotgun is grinning and sweating. The glare in his eyes s Please! Someone fuck up and let me kill! Gentry's eyes meet Leon's. Not here. Not now. Too many targets. Fate intervenes. A teenage girl exits the women's room unaware of what's going on and startles Shotgun, who pivo and fires. The round impacts near the girl. Gentry pulls his service revolver as Shotgun pumps another round into the chamber. Shotgun aims at the girl, enraged that she should expose fear, as Gentry takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Police! Freeze! Shotgun pivots and fires at Gentry in one instinctive mot Gentry leaps behind a table as the shotgun round takes ou the plate glass behind him, which shatters into ten thous pieces. Shotgun turns his weapon on Leon, who just now has cleare his service revolver. He drops like dead weight as, acros the fast food restaurant, Gentry rises and fires twice -- Bang! Bang! to send Shotgun sprawling, but not before his last round flips Leon's hiding table away as if it were a tent flap in the wind. Behind the counter, Handgun has witnessed the robbery tur merde and grabs the register girl, retreating toward the exit as she screams for help. Leon advances with his revolver as Shotgun, bloodied but out, crawls toward his weapon. Leon cocks the revolver.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Move and you die, asshole! Shotgun's eyes meet Leon's. His fingers are mere inches f the shotgun. He freezes. Gentry leaps the counter the moment Handgun drags the gir out of the place. A second later he bursts through the do  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry explodes through the door, weapon readied, only to find the countergirl screaming hysterically and Handgun nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Where is he? Where did he go? The countergirl won't stop screaming, but gestures toward back alley. Gentry takes off.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW GENTRY
dialogues.text: running flat-out at opposite ends of an alley. Handgun pivots in full flight, sees Gentry sprinting toward him, leaps laterally behind trash cans for cover. Gentry sees Handgun's maneuver but continues forward, mov toward one side of the alley as Handgun rises and fires. Gentry dives for a hill of abandoned storage flats, risin once to return fire before moving closer. Handgun rises and lays down a barrage of fire as he retre down an intersecting alley. Gentry leaps for cover as the rounds impact where he stood moments before, then rises a paces after the retreating gunman.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ALLEY
dialogues.text: as Gentry turns into the alley and sees that it's a dead- Four and five story buildings make the wall of the alley, at its end, a locked, gated fence. Gentry advances, servi revolver held ready, looking left and right, a swinging motion, the rhythm of predator seeking prey. A flattened cardboard box to one side moves an inch. Gent aims his weapon at the box and advances.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Police officer! Throw out your weapon! A lizard squirms from beneath the box an instant before Handgun bursts from behind oil drums on the other side of alley. He throws his empty gun at Gentry and explodes pas him. Gentry dodges the thrown gun, aims his revolver -- an eas shot.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 29.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Stop or I'll shoot! Handgun is in full flight. He has no intention of stoppin Gentry holsters his revolver and pursues. Handgun hits a fence and is nearly over when Gentry's han yank him down. Gentry has forty pounds of muscle on the k who responds to being manhandled by pulling a switchblade His first swipe cuts Gentry's cheek. His second is stoppe inches from penetrating Gentry's face. Gentry forces the knife-wielding arm back, breaks the kid's grip, then hits square in the face. Bam! The kid goes down. Gentry straddles Handgun and continues pounding on him -- Bam!-B Bam! -- the violence a catharsis. Leon, rushing up the alley, sees what's happening and mov to pull Gentry off the latino gang member.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay! You've got him, Pete! You've got him!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You're under arrest, asshole! Leon jerks Gentry free.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Okay! I think he knows that! Gentry wants more of him and in coiled frustration pivots marches down the alley as Leon cuffs the kid.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. REAR OF FAST FOOD PLACE
dialogues.text: Leon guides the manacled Handgun up the alley toward wait black-and-whites and an ambulance. Gentry leans against h Porsche smoking a cigarette. Leon turns Handgun over to two blue suits, gives them unh instructions, then walks to Gentry as, nearby, Shotgun is loaded into the ambulance on a gurney.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hey, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm fine.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 30.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Usually it's you pulling me off ‚Äòem.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (flicking cigarette away) Yeah, I blew it. Won't happen again. (sliding behind wheel) I'll meet you at Ericksen's office at four.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Sure. Four. The Porsche's engine turns over and the instant it catche roars away. Leon watches it go. Wondering what's become of his partne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's Porsche squeals to a stop behind Leon's very squ very obvious unmarked police unit. Leon's leaning against its side reading the Inquirer as Gentry trots up.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You still reading that shit?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You still don't get it, do ya? (gesturing paper) These guys are the best liars going. You want to study lying developed to an art, read -- Gentry has no time for this. Already moving for the entrance:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What about LAX?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Nothin'. No rentals charged to Ericksen's credit cards and only three cash rentals all day yesterday. You gotta have a thousand dollars to rent a car without a credit card, Pete.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 31.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: He's not going to use paper with his name attached, that's for sure. Maybe it's a leased car. Maybe he bought one used and never re- registered it.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Maybe there aint no car. Gentry ignores this. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: What about the cab companies?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Zip. Leon continues inside. Gentry stops. Something across the street in front of a drug store has captured his attentio Adrienne Ericksen standing beside a cab she's just exited Looking like she's about to break down. The sight stills him. Steeling herself, Adrienne enters the drug store and moment later Gentry enters the office building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUILDING MANAGER, an impeccably dressed man of 50, gu Leon and Gentry down a long corridor.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Used to lease that large suite up front on the left. You saw it when you came in. The travel agency is there now.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: How long since he moved to the back?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Six months. Everyone's certain Mr. Ericksen's setback is only temporary. He's a first-class professional who always pays his rent on time, or in advance. Until recently, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: He's behind in his rent? The Manager's expression suggests he hates to mention thi but...  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 32.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Two months in arrears. As of next week. They arrive at the door. Painted on an opaque glass inser Douglas Ericksen and Associates. The manager searches for key on a large, old-fashioned key ring.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It's a one-man operation?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: (opening the door) He let his secretary go last month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expensive business footage, but packed with too much furniture, stacks of files, unhung pictures and certifica Organizational despair. Gentry and Leon share a look. Oh shit... Ever the rental professional, the Manager moves for a win

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Here. Let me get some air in here. Leon begins thumbing through files stacked on a cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Where's the safe?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: It's embedded in the floor. There. Behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (looking) Do you have the combination?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: (officious) No, of course not. Tenants make their own arrangements regarding the floor safe. If I had my way they would have been yanked out years ago. They're altogether too much bother. First of all, they're a security risk. Second--  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 33.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Fine. There'll be someone in later to drill it. Gentry and Leon are already pouring over files and it's a moment before the Manager realizes he's been dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: On the desk amid file folders, a medium pizza box and a styrofoam container of half-eaten salad, the fork still s in its middle. Leon sits behind the desk with a folder open before him; Gentry stands near the door, another file folder opened i his hands. A technician kneels over the safe. The drill whines in hi hands. Leon closes his file.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Jesus. This guy was in deep. Either he had a lot of money and didn't mind losing it, or he was playing with somebody's else's scratch. Gentry drops his folder in front of Leon.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Have a look at this. He was kiting funds from one investment account to another trying to cover his losses. The drill whine stops.

dialogues.speaker: DRILLER
dialogues.text: That's it. She's open. He pulls the safe open. A moment later Gentry lifts the cache basket from the safe.

dialogues.speaker: DRILLER
dialogues.text: (holding out form) Somebody want to sign this?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 34. Leon signs it as Gentry quickly goes through the document the basket: A small stack of 20s paper-clipped together, various mortgage and lease contracts, and an insurance packet. Gentry flips to the back page. Two items stick ou $2.000.000.00 and Beneficiary: Douglas Ericksen and/or Adrienne Ericksen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry closes the driver's door of Leon's unmarked car an leans down.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (fingering reasons) Okay. We got motive. Ericksen was desperate for money and he had a two million dollar survivor's benefit insurance policy. We got opportunity. His wife home alone on a deserted stretch of beach. All we need is method.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Wait a second! Wait! Wait! All we need is method? Now you're sure the husband set her up?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I aint sure o'nothin'. I'm just saying we can wrap this sucker up if we play our cards right. Leon starts his engine.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Find Ericksen's rental car, Leon. The sedan pulls away from the curb. Gentry watches Leon's car diminish down the street, then glances back at the still-open pharmacy across the street He makes for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry approaches the prescription desk. A woman clerk mo up from stocking shelves to attend him.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACY CLERK
dialogues.text: Yes, may I help you?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 35.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: There was a woman who filled a prescription here this afternoon. I'd like to know what it was.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACY CLERK
dialogues.text: That's privileged infor -- Gentry shows her his police badge.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACY CLERK
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Adrienne Ericksen.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACY CLERK
dialogues.text: One moment...

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: the clerk returns.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACY CLERK
dialogues.text: Fifty capsules of Seconal. It's a sedative. She had her doctor increase the dosage to a hundred milligrams each.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry steps inside the glass enclosure, fishes a coin ou and dials. A moment later he hears Adrienne's phone answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You've reached the home of Douglas and Adrienne Ericksen. We can't come to the phone right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is dark. On a small antique desk Adrienne's answering machine is working.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: -- but if you'll leave your name and your number, and the time you called, Douglas or I will get back to you as quickly as possible.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 36. Adrienne. Across the room. Tear-filled eyes. Surveying darkness.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen... Adrienne. This is Pete Gentry. I know you're going through a difficult time right now. If you should need some help, or someone to talk to, feel free to call me. My number is 213-995- 7277... ‚ÄòNight. Adrienne has not moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry lowers the phone to its cradle, thoughtful a long moment before he pivots and moves for his car still parke across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry paces the car, taking corners on two wheels and generally pushing city driving to the hilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry paces down the hall. He fishes for his keys. The next door down opens. Linda steps out. She's wearing a shirt. Probably his. One button joined. And nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Pete? Gentry takes one look at her. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Pete, about last night. I'm sorry. About putting you in that situation, I mean. Gentry puts his keys away, walks to her. His intense star ignites more words:

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: I just... wanted to see you and that other guy -- I don't know how it happened, really. I mean, I was thinking of you when... His thumbs trail down each side of the shirt to the only button. In one swift, powerful jolt he yanks her to him, snapping the button and pinning her naked body to him.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 37. Gentry kisses her long and hard, then reaches up behind a under the shirt, lifts her off the ground and carries her into her apartment, their lips still joined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes behind them. Linda's feet still dangle inches from the floor. Gentry peels the shirt from her bo with one hand. She is completely naked. Still they kiss. The shirt drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Both naked now, Linda's legs have Gentry in a scissor-loc he spins her around and around the apartment. She squeals with delight.

dialogues.speaker: LATER YET
dialogues.text: Linda lies face-down on the bed as Gentry, out of shot, pounds her in rhythmic succession. Linda's cries rise to crescendo.

dialogues.speaker: LATER EVEN YET
dialogues.text: Linda and Gentry lie on her bed. She's asleep. Gentry's cigarette ash glows, casting them in brief amber light, t dies. In the instant of its radiance Gentry's troubled fa burns in brilliant clarity. Linda is not Adrienne. Gentry snaps up, frustrated and angry. Linda turns over, fully asleep, and does not see him get dressed and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry enters still buttoning his shirt. He takes a bottl of beer from the fridge, pries its cap off, and drinks thirstily. The blinking light of his phone answering mach beckons from across the room. A moment later, he rewinds the tape, turns it to replay.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (troubled) Sergeant Gentry... I wanted to tell you... I want you to understand that it has nothing to do with you. It's me. It's... After Douglas and what's happened, I just don't know... what there is to live for any more... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deceptions by Richard Taylor 38. ADRIENNE'S VOICE (cont'd) (long silence) I just want to tell you that -- But before this last sentence is completed Gentry is runn for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry drives like a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's Porsche skids to an angled stop before the drive He leaps from the car, leaving the driver's door agape be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry runs down the walk to the side door and knocks quickly. When there is no answer, he knocks again before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen? Mrs. Ericksen? Adrienne! Gentry kicks. The door whips open. Gentry charges in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne sits at the kitchen table before a small mountai pills. Trails of recent tears mark her face. Gentry is stunned by the sight of her. This lovely woman looks near death. For moments neither can say anything. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I couldn't... (tearfully) I just couldn't... Gentry rushes to her and pulls her into an embrace. He ho her close. She begins to sob into his chest. Finally he sweeps her up into his arms and moves for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry puts her into her bed, then pulls the covers up. H shuts off the lights before taking a chair beside her:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It's okay. I won't leave you. Adrienne's amazed eyes remain on him awhile. Then sleep.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 39.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Gentry awakens in the chair and starts when he finds Adri gone. He spins -- and sees her standing in the shadows. Adrienne has showered. She wears a bathrobe and her hair combed back and still wet. She just looks at Gentry as he steps to her side. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: This isn't right.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: He tried to murder you, Mrs. Erick--

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Addie.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: He tried to kill you, Addie. For the insurance. He was in deep. Kiting money from one account to another to keep things covered. He was a no good son of a bitch and he She touches his lips, shushing him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I can't trust my feelings for tomorrow, but -- Her eyes engage his, searching for a sign that he understands.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I want you. Now. She pulls on the robe cinch and it loosens. The robe fall to the floor. Gentry takes in her exquisite nakedness. Sh reaches up to him, kissing, caressing, gently undoing buttons.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE-MAKING
dialogues.text: Fingertips caress. Lips hover, then sensuously kiss flesh Moist lips meet and part, creating a bridge of their juic Sweat gathers, then rolls langurously across taut skin. Fingers entwine, release, tighten. Adrienne gasps. Gentry tenses. The moment arrives.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 40.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Now it is Gentry who sleeps as Adrienne studies him, gent caressing his brow. Finally, she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just after dawn. Addie remains on her side studying him a Gentry awakens. At first disoriented, it takes a moment f Gentry to realize he's died and gone to heaven. Beneath t sheet is one beautiful, naked woman. He grins. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: A little after six. Sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Like a vampire in a blood bank. Addie grins. She begins to caress his shoulder and chest. Proprietary.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: So what now... Officer?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I've got to get this case wrapped up. Her hands explore down below the sheet, gently caressing. For Gentry, her touch is an aphrodisiac. As she touches h

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I thought you said you had it wrapped up?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Well, there are some procedural things left. We've got to document each step your husband took that night. The only things missing are the rental car and his return ticket to San Francisco. Until then, officially at least, the case stays open and you remain a suspect. And --  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 41. A wrenching motion, Adrienne rolls herself back on top of him. Flesh-to-flesh, eye-to-eye:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (finishing for him) It's bad form to screw a suspect.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (a slow grin) Yeah. Bad form.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: work the phones... type reports... other cops around usin the phones too... nobody around but Gentry and Leon... clothes disheveled... feet propped up on the table... sitting straight... Leon staples papers together, leaves with them... returns and mans a phone again... time passing... shit work is boring... Finally:

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: lodging a phone to his ear with a shoulder, taps out a be on the table-top with a pencil. He's on hold. Leon enters with several cups of steaming liquid. One of them is coff He sets it in front of Gentry, then unpackages and drops tea bag into his hot water. Gentry sits up straight.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... You're sure they checked all the alleys?... Well, I don't know. A rental car, probably. Something nondescript... Okay... No, leave it up another day. (hangs up) It's been seventy two hours. If the car's there, it should have shown up by now. (beat) We could file the report without the rental car.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: The DA'1l raise hell.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Fuck him.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 42. A Blue Suit leans in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE SUIT
dialogues.text: Hey, Gentry, there's a woman here to see you. A Mrs. Ericksen. Gentry freezes. Leon barks a laugh. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Okay. Show her in.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Jesus, Pete, nice goin'. Play your cards right, you can slice off a piece of that. When Gentry ignores him:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I saw the way you looked at her the other night! What happened? You went out there to get her statement and she looked back, right?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (softly) Shut the fuck up, Leon. The Blue Suit leads Addie to the door. She's gorgeous in ordinary, every-day pantsuit. Gentry meets her at the doo and questions her with his eyes. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen, I'm kinda surprised to see you here. Her expression flutters a brief recognition as Gentry gui her inside.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Can I get you something? Coffee? A soft drink?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No, thank you. (to Leon) Officer -- ? I'm sorry. I've forgotten your name.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Kessler. Detective Kessler.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 43.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Mrs. Ericksen. For a brief, awkward moment it's as if no one knows how t proceed. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What brings you here to the station, Mrs. Ericksen? Addie gives both men a brief look before:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Well, I decided to pay some bills. Keep my mind occupied. Stay busy. Anyway, I found something in our receipts. Something odd. She gives Leon a credit card receipt who peruses it brief before handing it over to Gentry.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It's just a Chevron credit card receipt. I don't understand the significance--

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Look at the box for the license plate number. You know, at some gas stations they write down the license plate number. Gentry glances at the receipt.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh...

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: This one isn't for our car. Gentry and Leon share a look. Not her license plate numbe

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I don't know if it means anything. I just thought it was strange, that's all. It's dated just last week and-- Gentry picks up the phone and dials. When Adrienne questi this with a look:  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 44.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: This could be the break we've been waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's Porsche scoots through the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry is out of the car and heading for the office befor Leon can struggle from the low Porsche. A clerk in oily jeans and t-shirt exits the office. Gentr badges him.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: LAPD. Where's the Chrysler you just brought it?

dialogues.speaker: IMPOUND CLERK
dialogues.text: (gestures) Over there.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Is it locked?

dialogues.speaker: IMPOUND CLERK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: We'll need a slim-jim.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CHRYSLER
dialogues.text: wait as the clerk approaches with a slim-jim. Gentry take it from him and expertly "pops" the passenger door lock. Using a kerchief to protect any fingerprints, he opens th glove compartment. A moment later he hands a packet to Le holding it by its edge: Airline tickets. Leon opens the packet on the hood of the car using a retracted pen to hold the pages extended. Meanwhile Gentr finds another document in the glove compartment: Pink sli

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Airline tickets made out to a Phil Golden. Round trip from San Francisco International to LAX and back. One of ‚Äòem expended on the night of the 14th.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 45. Gentry slides out of the car. He is already slipping the pink slip into a clear plastic evidence bag.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I was right. He didn't rent a car. He bought it. (gestures pink slip) Signed over by the seller two months ago. All he had to do was resell the car without registering it and there would be no record he ever owned it.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Careful, wasn't he?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Not careful enough. Gentry gives Leon another evidence bag. Leon inserts the tickets as:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Pop the trunk. Leon leans inside and taps the trunk solenoid. The trunk rises. Gentry back-tracks to look in the trunk and Leon follows him. As they peruse its every-day contents:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Wraps it up.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (not satisfied) Yeah, I guess so... Seeing Leon's reluctance:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Nothing. Nothing's the matter.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: If you were married to Adrienne Ericksen, could you bring yourself to kill her? Just for money? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deceptions by Richard Taylor 46. LEON (cont'd) He could have found an easier way to turn a buck than by murdering his wife for the insurance money... Now if there was another reason... like a girlfriend... now that I could believe. Gentry pauses, considers. Then smiles at his partner.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I don't buy a girlfriend Leon gives him a look that asks, "Oh?"

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: With a wife like her at home, who needs another woman?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (big grin) Hey, people always want what they don't got. Guy has a beautiful woman at home, he goes out and sleeps with dogs, the ugliest women he can find. Or maybe he wants a brunette or a redhead 'cause the little woman is a blond.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I still don't buy it.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: That's from your perspective because she's something you don't got. Gentry slams the trunk. A little too hard. Turns back to Leon.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: So what are you saying? You're saying we should look for an accomplice, Ericksen's girlfriend? Leon considers it for a moment. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Nah. (gestures bags) This shit's too good. Let's file this sucker and forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: Deceptions by Richard Taylor 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry pounds away at an old manual typewriter, finishing Ericksen case report. Leon sits nearby going through their previous reports. He stops. Something is bothering him. He picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LESTER FENADY, early 30s, a handsome, well-groomed man wh takes great pride in his appearance, picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Les Fenady. May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Detective Kessler, Mr. Fenady. Los Angeles Police Department. Do you remember selling a round-trip ticket to San Francisco on the tenth of this month?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I sell a lot of tickets, officer. If you can give me a ticket number, I'll bring it up on the computer. Maybe it'll ring a bell.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (reading) One "D," as in dog, four nine seven one six six three.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Hold on. Lester taps the numbers into his console. A moment later information comes up onto the screen. Lester studies it a moment before:

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I remember this one. Paid in cash.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Think you could identify him?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: No.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 48.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I thought you said you remembered --

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: It wasn't aman. It was a woman. And she I can identify. As a matter of fact, I'd like to, if it meant I could see her again.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SQUAD ROOM
dialogues.text: lowers the phone and looks over at Gentry, who's pounding away at the manual typewriter. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hey, Pete. Stop.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (still typing) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: The case isn't closed. I got a guy here who says he can identify Ericksen's accomplice. His girlfriend. Leon grins. Gentry stops and looks at Leon as he returns phone receiver to his ear. Girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester Fenady sits beside a COMPUTER OPERATOR who inputs comments. A woman's face is beginning to take shape on th screen.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: No, her chin isn't so pointed.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER OPERATOR
dialogues.text: You mean like this? He taps in a few commands. The girl's chin becomes less pointed.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's more like it.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 49.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Across the room, Gentry stands watching the laser printer spit out the first hard copy. It slides into a wire baske Gentry picks it up, looks at it: Adrienne. Different hair. Different make-up. Almost a honky-tonk version of Adrienne, but almost certainly her nonetheless. Gentry covers her hair. The resemblance is m striking.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER OPERATOR'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Anybody you know? Gentry spins, startled by the Operator's unintentional stealth.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What? He's kidding, but he asks it again:

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Anybody you know?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (not convincing) No, I don't think so. Leon moves up behind Gentry as the computer operator leav and stares past him at the artist's depiction in his hand

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Looks like I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: About Ericksen's girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (dry throat) Oh? How's that?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: She's no dog. Gentry continues to stare at the drawing as Leon crosses room to retrieve his jacket from the back of a chair.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 50.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hey, Pete. I'm goin' home. wanna Xerox that for R&I? You From across the room, Leon realizes that Gentry hasn't mo He gives him a quizzical look before:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hey, you hear me? I said --

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Sure. I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: See ya tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Right. Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry watches copy after copy of the sketch slide out of photocopy machine, images of Adrienne, one after another. scoops up a dozen and makes for a desk. Gentry draws a new hairstyle onto one of the copies, alte the make-up look with a few nervous scrawls... and sits b

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Half of the sketches have been altered by Gentry's inexpe hand. No matter how many times you ask the question, the answer's the same: Adrienne. He dumps all of the copies into a briefcase and shuts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He powers the metal beast down the Coast Highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche rolls to a stop in the gravel. Gentry slides slowly. Weighted down. Pulling the briefcase out of the car, Gentry makes For a long moment Finally he enters. for the walkway leading to the side door. Gentry stands before the door, indecisive.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry enters. No one home, apparently. He sets the briefcase down on the counter, moves for the sliding door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Addie lies sunbathing on a lounger. Gentry appears at the sliding door and takes her in a moment before he exits. H walks to the rail, looks out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: No. Nothing. Addie rises, moves up behind Gentry and begins to massage neck and shoulders. Fighting it, Gentry finds the massage nonetheless wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I think you could use a drink.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne moves for the liquor cabinet. Gentry watches her moment before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: We found the car. Addie faces him. Radiating happiness.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Then it's over! This whole ugly mess is behind us! Gentry looks at the briefcase on the counter. Can't tell the truth. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's over. Adrienne sees Gentry‚Äôs brief look at the briefcase. She takes his arm and leads him toward the stairs.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 52.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You look beat. Why don't you go upstairs and take a shower... No, I have a better idea. Why don't we go upstairs and take a shower? She kisses him. Gentry tries to respond, but cannot. Then

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Addie?... Did you ever suspect your husband of having a mistress? The question causes a quake somewhere deep inside her. Sh conceals it.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: No reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Addie releases Gentry just inside the door and goes to tu on the water in the shower. Steam billows over the top of the glass wall before she returns and begins to unbutton unfasten his clothes. He stops her.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: No... No, look, you go ahead. I just want to relax for a little while. Unwind. I'll take a shower later. Only momentarily disappointed:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Have it your own way. She takes several steps toward the shower, then spins and loosens the robe tie.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Just so you know what you're missing. The robe falls to the floor. She grins, turns and walks t and inside the shower. Gentry watches her go. Unable to look away. Smitten. Chained. Only after the shower door closes does he retreat from the bathroom.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry stops in the doorway from the bathroom and takes i the room. Gentry quickly peruses the top of Adrienne's vanity, noting ironically her brand of perfume, Deceit, before moving to her desk. At the desk Gentry takes one look over his shoulder at th open bathroom door. Steam still rises, billowing out. Gentry sits, thinks about it a moment, then pulls open th drawer. He finds Adrienne's appointment and address book. He opens it, begins going down the list. First page: Nothing. Second: No. Third... Adrienne grabs him from behind! She cups his eyes and laughs, her naked, soapy body staining his clothes. Gentr twists and the appointment/address book tumbles to the fl Addie falls into his arms, unaware or uncaring about the book. For a long moment he holds her, their eyes locked. eyes take in her wet, exquisite body. She begins to unbut his shirt, then rips it open in frustration, kissing his chest and nipples.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (between kisses) Pete, I'm sorry... so sorry, I... can't... help... it... I... want... you... to... Oh! Gentry's reserve breaks like a cracked dam. He stands and yanks her up into his arms and carries her to the bed. Sh crashes onto it but is up in an instant to undo his pants

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: their naked bodies writhe in unleashed lust. Addie cries pleasure and sweet pain as Gentry grabs her great mane of hair, riding forward like a charging warrior.

dialogues.speaker: LATER EVEN YET
dialogues.text: they lie entwined, lovers whose last drop of passion has spent on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry lies sleeping. Addie studies him. She rises, caref not to awaken him, slips on a robe and moves for the door  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 54. KITCHEN ‚Äî- ADRIENNE enters the kitchen, where Gentry left his briefcase. She snaps the second lock out, then opens the case. Inside ar the copies of the computer-generated sketch. Startled, Ad turns on a light and studies the sketches, each with a different scribble to make it look more like her. At the bottom of each picture is printed (by computer) Description of ticket purchaser by Lester Fenady. Startled by a noise behind her, Adrienne shuts the case a spins around... only to find her cat, Buttermilk, meowing attention. She kneels to pet Buttermilk. Just then Gentry enters the kitchen. She starts.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Oh!... I couldn't sleep. I just came down for a drink. What about you? Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: No thanks. Adrienne moves for the door. Looking back over her should

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You coming?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I'll be there in a minute. Adrienne leaves. Gentry opens the briefcase. The sketch o Adrienne/look-alike sits on top of a pile of papers. Did see the sketch?, a worried look at the door asks. Gentry closes the case and spins the combination locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Addie and Gentry sit across the breakfast table from one another. Each eats quietly. Inner thoughts. Tension. Gentry's beeper goes off. He stands, taps a number into t wall phone.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Gentry here.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon sits on the communal desk. A multi-page phone bill i spread out before him.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Pete, I've been going over Ericksen's phone bill. I think I found something.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (eyeing Adrienne) What?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Calls made from his Beverly Hills office to a residence in San Pedro. All of them made after seven p.m. and all made on a week-night, most of them Tuesdays, Wednesdays or Thursdays.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: His mistress.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Got an address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry paces toward his car. The moment he slides behind wheel and turns the key in the ignition, Adrienne strolls from the walkway to watch him go. The Porsche's starting motor drones, the cold engine almost catches, then dies. Gentry tries it again. It dies again.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Want me to call Triple-A?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
