dialogues.text: No. It's cold, that's all. The engine catches. Gentry throws it in reverse and the Porsche screeches out of the driveway.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's Porsche is parked in front along with two black- whites and Leon's unmarked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two uniformed cops stand outside the door as Gentry enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry finds LASZLO KINSKI, late 30s, a lean and intellig man who speaks with a faint Eastern European accent, "dusting" a table.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Hey, Laszlo. Where's Leon?

dialogues.speaker: LASZLO
dialogues.text: (without looking up) Bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry enters and finds Leon nearly engulfed by clothes i the wall closet.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Leon.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hey, Pete. Leon has found something.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Look at this. He opens a suit coat displaying a label. Reading:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hand-made for Douglas Ericksen by Cleve and Sons, London Tailors. Gentry takes one look at the label before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Bingo. The coat lands on the bed.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 57.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: There are now two nearly equal piles of clothing on the b half suits and sportcoats, the other half dresses and blouses. Gentry tosses the last jacket as Leon checks the last dress. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Look at this shit! This isn't Paris originals shit; this is K- Mart shit! I don't get it. Ericksen was a classy guy, right? But this broad dresses like she's on welfare. Something else bothers me. There's nothing personal here. No family pictures. No phone books or old mail or just plain crap she couldn't bring herself to throw away.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Maybe there isn't anything she can't throw away.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: That would make her a strange woman, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry enters to find Laszlo "dusting" one side of a vani table too large for the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: So how's it look?

dialogues.speaker: LASZLO
dialogues.text: Pretty clean. Gentry turns his attention to the opposite side of the ta where several dozen perfume and lotion bottles are arrang

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You done here?

dialogues.speaker: LASZLO
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nothing. One bottle beckons: Deceit. The same scent Adrienne wears Gentry stares at it a long moment before picking it up. I remains in his hand, a symbol for something far more important, until:  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 58.

dialogues.speaker: LASZLO
dialogues.text: That's pretty good stuff. My girlfriend uses it. Startled, Gentry composes himself before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, so does Ericksen's wife. Something catches Gentry's attention, a fold of thick pap wedged behind the vanity table. He kneels, slips his hand under the table and pulls the paper out: A take-out menu from a Greek restaurant, Alexander's. Gentry studies the menu's logo. This is the first persona clue found in "Marta's" apartment.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR DAY
dialogues.text: looking through the plate glass window as Lester Fenady tosses a wave to an assistant and leaves. Fenady climbs into a new Mazda RX7 parked in front. The c pulls into traffic. The point of view follows him...

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: WE WATCH Fenady's RX7 pull into the garage, the WE GLIDE down-the street.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: as Fenady enters the house and unbuttons his shirt as he walks toward the phone. An instant later Fenady has diale the phone. He grins, obviously talking to someone very intimate. Still grinning, he hangs up, goes to the door a unlocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: navigates around the side of the house through the bushes the REAR DECK, watching as Fenady, wearing only a towel, exits the house while pulling the cork out of a bottle of champagne. He drops the bottle into an ice bucket, slips cassette into a nearby boom box, yanks the towel free and slides into a steaming hot tub.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Fenady, oblivious to this intruder, pours himself a gl of champagne and settles back for a little hedonistic pleasure. Gloved hands -- those of this intruder -- reach out and l the boom box over the back of Fenady's head. Still plugge in, the box drops into the water. Fenady's spasmodic body almost leaps from the tub. But he settles back into the frothy mass of water, boiling like a two-minute egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry and Leon wait as the apartment manager, MR. ZAZEL, a Lithuanian emigre to America, stares at the police sket of Adrienne/look-alike. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: Yes, this is her. She live here, oh -- four month. Maybe five. She pay cash. Always cash.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Did she give any references?

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: No. No references. Just cash.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Did she have any visitors? Anyone you might remember?

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: There was man, big man. Maybe boyfriend. He come visit. Leon produces the coroner's photograph of Ericksen.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Was this the man? Zazel takes it from Leon's hand and studies it before:

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: Not sure. Maybe. A uniformed cop steps up.

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
dialogues.text: Sergeant Gentry?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 60.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
dialogues.text: I just got a call for you about a witness, a guy named Fenady?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry, Leon and a bulbous cop, FATCOP, pace through Fena house.

dialogues.speaker: FATCOP
dialogues.text: His girl friend found him, say one- thirty. She came over and there he was floating in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Homicide dejour.

dialogues.speaker: FATCOP
dialogues.text: Accidental death. Clear and simple. Don't you guys try and fuck up my case load.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Shit. Hate to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fatcop leads Gentry and Leon through Fenady's back door t the deck. Fenady's naked body floats in the tub. The cassette player, its cord still plugged into a nearby flo socket, is wedged between his flesh and the tub side.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (eyeing body) I think he's done.

dialogues.speaker: FATCOP
dialogues.text: Cute.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You should know Fenady was a witness in an on-going homicide investigation.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 61.

dialogues.speaker: FATCOP
dialogues.text: That the way you guys see this? Homicide? I see accidental death. Gentry kneels to have a closer look at the boom box.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: FATCOP
dialogues.text: He's in the tub. He reaches over there -- (gestures table) to change the channel and --

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: There's a cassette in the player.

dialogues.speaker: FATCOP
dialogues.text: Okay, then, change the cassette. He touches the boom box, it shorts out and he can't let go. He drags it into the tub and fries.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Not fry. Poach, maybe, but not fry.

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: Gentry and Leon make their way to the door.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Or maybe Ericksen's girlfriend is trying to get rid of any witnesses. Fenady could have tied her to the attempted murder of Mrs. Ericksen.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I could believe it myself except for one thing.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What's that?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 62.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: How did she find out about Fenady? How'd she get his address? But Gentry's mind is too occupied with dark thoughts for to respond. Adrienne. The police sketch. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You know what I think? I think the girlfriend was the brains behind Ericksen. She's the one who talked him into trying to kill his wife... I think we got one smart, crazy bitch out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry stands at the rail staring out to sea. The door slides open behind him. Addie steps out with two wind- shielded candles and places them on the dining table that been set up on the deck. She lights each candle, then tur to look at Gentry. Sensing his emotional distance, she co up behind him, loops her arms through his, then circles h for a kiss. His lips are as cold as marble. Adrienne draw back.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: There's something on your mind. What is it? Gentry doesn't answer, continues staring out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Won't you tell me -- ?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Where were you today?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Answer the question. Where were you today?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Here. There. Gentry turns the cold steel of his eyes on her. Suddenly frightened, Adrienne draws away from him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I went to the market.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 63.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete, I -- Closing in on her:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Three thirty. Four.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What were you doing earlier?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: What time?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Early afternoon. Around one. Gentry's tone is that of a prosecutor. Adrienne is almost tears.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I went for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Here. On the beach.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Any witnesses?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Witnesses? No, I... No! Pete, tell me what's going on! He stares into her eyes for a long moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You're telling me you don't know?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: That's right. That's what I'm telling you.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 64.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I asked you if your husband had a girlfriend, remember? Remember what you said?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I spent some time in San Pedro today. Know anything about San Pedro, Adrienne?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It's where your husband's girlfriend lives.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (stunned) What are you talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You're telling me you didn't know he had a girlfriend? IS THAT WHAT

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete, I... I... He says nothing. Waits. She's shaking, the tears coming now.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Her name's Marta. I don't know her last name. She knew Douglas before... before he and I... The first time we met, Douglas said I reminded him of someone. Except I was prettier, he said. I asked him about her, but he wouldn't tell me anything, except that it was all over. She left him for another man, that's all he would say. And then four, maybe five months ago...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: He started seeing her again. Did he tell you?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 65.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No... She did! She's crazy, Pete. She came to the house! She was scary. Weird! She threatened me! Sobbing now, Adrienne can't go on. She flinches at his touch.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: And then what?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I moved out. I went to a hotel. I told Douglas he had to choose between us. I couldn't live that way. And he... and he chose me... I thought.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me any of this?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I... It was too painful. Like opening an old wound. I didn't want you to know because... just being a part of it made me feel dirty. I wanted to start fresh. With you. Gentry studies her in silence before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: He said you reminded him of Marta. Did he say why?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: The time I saw her I knew why. It was really uncanny, she looked so much like me. We could have been sisters. Adrienne wipes tears from her eyes and tries to compose herself.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Why were you asking me those questions about what I did today? (when he doesn't answer) Something's happened... TELL ME,

dialogues.speaker: DAMN IT
dialogues.text: Deceptions by Richard Taylor 66. Gentry considers it a long moment making up his mind, the pulls a folded Xerox of Adrienne/look-alike from his pock and gives it to her.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Is that Marta? Stunned and fearful even in the presence of Marta's liken Adrienne gestures yes.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: What did she do?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: We think she's your husband's accomplice. She helped him set up an alibi.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: That's all? Gentry almost doesn't answer. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: No. There was a man who could have identified her. He died today. It may have been homicide.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Oh my god... Gentry takes the drawing from her hands, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: She looks a lot like you.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Yes, I know... (realizing) You think... thought it was me!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I didn't know what to think. Adrienne turns from him and buries her face in her hands, crying. Gentry turns her about, pulls her into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Oh, Pete, I'm scared... What if she comes after me?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: She won't. I won't let her.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 67. And the way he says it, the kind of guy he is, she believ it totally. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry turns the Porsche engine over. Adrienne watches fr the gate holding her robe shut with folded hands. The starter motor drones on, without effect. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I could call someone. Frustrated, Gentry crawls out of the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: No time. I'll get a cab.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You can take my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry slips behind the wheel of Adrienne's Mercedes. The engine catches immediately. Gentry guides the luxury car out onto the Coast Highway, up-Sunset Boulevard. Deciding to see what this baby can d he checks the rear-view mirror, sees no one, then floors The Mercedes bolts forward. Gentry settles in behind the wheel, enjoying the speed, testing the Mercedes against Sunset Boulevard's curves an hills. Far ahead, he sees a street light turn red. He applies the brakes. Nothing. Worse, the Mercedes hasn't slowed its accelerati It jets forward, increasing speed. Gentry pulls the emergency brake. Useless. The Mercedes dashes for the stop light. Cars cross the intersection at intervals. The light remains red. Gentry slams a palm down on the horn. It blares a warning. The Mercedes shoots through the intersection, barely miss two crossing cars, and continues on, Gentry twisting its wheel to avoid hitting anyone and slamming his foot on th brake repeatedly. He passes cars on the left, then right, and knowing he can hold off destruction no longer, Gentry opens the driver's door and leaps free. He rolls to the s of the road as the Mercedes impacts against a stone wall explodes in a fiery flash.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 68. Gentry stands, shaken, a few scratches marking his brush death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An LAPD black-and-white shoots up the highway. Gentry rid shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black-and-white screeches to a stop and Gentry bolts of the sedan and runs toward the house. Two uniform patrolmen exit their cruiser and watch him go. At the side door, Gentry bolts inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry runs inside, looks in the kitchen, then rushes int the living room.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Addie! Adrienne! Adrienne stops at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete? Seeing his crazed condition and torn clothes, she descend the steps hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: What happened? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: The car. Your Mercedes. Someone tampered with it.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: The accelerator stuck. No brakes. I just drove it into a wall... Someone just tried to kill you. They almost killed me instead. Adrienne is stunned. She considers the ramifications of t as she lowers herself to the couch. Then:  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 69.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete!... It's Marta, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I want you to stay inside, keep the doors locked. And here, take this - Gentry pulls his service .38 out and hands it to her butt first. Adrienne looks at it. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I have a gun, remember? (finally) And I know how to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry exits and turns to take Adrienne into his arms. Th kiss. Gentry lingers in the doorway savoring her before h turns and makes for the gate... where Leon stands with a sizable grin on his face. He's seen them together.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Doing a little... undercover work, Pete? Gentry stops dead, takes a look over his shoulder to insu Adrienne hasn't seen Leon -- she hasn't; the door is long since closed -- before turning to again face him. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Okay. So now you know.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hey, don't get your back up. I'm sympathetic. Envious, even. I mean, that is one fine looking woman you have in there...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What brings you out here, Leon?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I get a call that says my partner was almost turned into asphalt fondue, I'm interested. Gentry considers that a moment before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm sorry. Thanks for giving a shit.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 70.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Pete, I'ma liberal guy --

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (grinning) Sure you are.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: A man wants to dip the bucket in a strange well, I figure that's okay. Who am I to say no? But if the broad is a suspect --

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry, Leon. I should have told you about Adrienne.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: No, that isn't it.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (continuous ) I wanted to. I really did. I just

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (forceful) No. That isn't it. (beat) She's a suspect in a murder investigation. She's suspected of killing her husband! And now you almost kiss some concrete at sixty miles an hour! Do I have to draw you a picture?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You don't understand --

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe I do and maybe I don't. But I'm doing my thinking with an organ located above my neck. Which is more than I can say for you. Steamed, Gentry almost physically confronts Leon. Only respect and love keep him from pinning the older man agai the wall.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe I am breaking a couple of rules! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deceptions by Richard Taylor 71. GENTRY (cont'd) But I'm not stupid and I haven't changed over-night, so don't treat me like a rookie, Leon!... Adrienne didn't sabotage her own car. Marta did!

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Who's Marta?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Ericksen's mistress. Adrienne knew her, met her once, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: She ID'd the sketch?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Why didn't she come forward with this before?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: She thought it was over. She had no reason to suspect her husband was working with his ex-lover.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: And now this Marta is out for revenge, that it?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. She sabotaged the car. She blames Adrienne for killing Ericksen. Leon studies Gentry before:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: So what are they, identical twins?... I'm not blind. Fenady's sketch could be your girlfriend there --

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: She explained that. When she met Ericksen, he told her she reminded him of someone. His ex-fiance'. Marta. What? You don't think a man can be attracted to two women for the same reasons?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 72.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I hope you're right, ‚Äòcause if you're not...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (firm) I'm right.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Good enough. He pivots and exits through the gate. Gentry turns... and sees a movement in the nearby window. Adrienne? overhear them? Gentry moves for his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she Pulling on his coat, Leon approaches Gentry who is going various reports at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (checks wristwatch) I've got a doctor's appointment at three and then I'm meeting Roberta for dinner. We're trying out a Hungarian restaurant that specializes in small furry insects fried in their own milk. Wanna come along?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Sounds... appetizing. But I gota couple things to follow up here. Maybe next time. Leon heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Okay. Want me to bring you the left-overs?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Nah. I'd be afraid they'd get loose and mate with the locals. Leon grins, throws Pete a wave and exits. The moment he's gone, Gentry's smile fades. He sits thinking. Fenady's sketch of Adrienne's look-alike peeks above a briefcase partition.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 73. He brings the drawing out, exposing the take-out menu fro Alexander's Restaurant found at "Marta's" apartment. Gent places both objects on the desk and looks at them a long moment before picking up the phone. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mr. Zazel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is dreary and old. Zazel, wearing a bathrobe, stands beside an old-fashioned telephone table.

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: Yes. Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Sergeant Gentry, LAPD. I met you yesterday regarding one of your tenants?

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: Yes... What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I'm wondering if you could give us some help in identifying someone?

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: Come down there? Pictures?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: No, actually, point someone out in a restaurant. Could you do that?

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: Sure. I can. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: There's a Greek restaurant called Alexander's there in town. Could you meet me there about seven- thirty?

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: I don't drive car, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: That's okay. I'1l pick you up. Seven-thirty, okay?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor

dialogues.speaker: ZAZEL
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SQUAD ROOM
dialogues.text: hangs up. An instant later he redials.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (phone) Adrienne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Addie, wanna grab a bite out tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (warming) Getting tired of my cooking?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Never... Like Greek food?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: There's this place I like a lot, Alexander's. It's in San Pedro. Know it? 74. The word Alexander's impacts immediately. Adrienne covers her concern.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Is that the place on the channel?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You've been there?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I think... someone took me there a long time ago.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 75.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Meet you at eight?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Sure. Eight o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's Porsche pulls up before Zazel's apartment buildi and he gets out, moving for the steps and ascending. Gent taps lightly on the door. It swings open.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mr. Zazel? Gentry leans inside.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Mr. Zazel?...

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR ZAZEL'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Gentry steps inside the nearly dark apartment. Having received no answer to his call, he reaches for his servic revolver when a shadowy figure steps from behind a door a hits him. Gentry collapses as the figure, briefly seen to a woman, rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR ZAZEL'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Moments have passed. Or hours. Gentry moans, reaches up t his head and then looks at his hand. Blood. Gentry crawls to a table, uses it to rise, then almost topples a lamp before finding its switch. Light explodes into the room. Blood has trickled and almost dried on his brow. Dizzy, Gentry almost falls, then rights himself. Something catches his attention across the room. Zazel. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two coroner's assistants guide a gurney toward a waiting wagon. Two uniformed cops finish querying Gentry (unheard for their report and walk away, leaving him leaning again his Porsche, swathing his head with a ball of gauze he go earlier from ambulance attendants.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 76. Gentry watches the old man's body being loaded into the Coroner's wagon. Thoughts. Suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry enters and moves for the Matre'D's desk. Blood and sweat still caked on his face, Gentry's appearance is a startling contrast to the diners about him.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: The name is Gentry. I'm late. I have an eight o'clock reservation.

dialogues.speaker: MATRE 'D
dialogues.text: But sir! It's after nine!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's fine. I'm just checking to see if my date arrived. Has anyone -- ?

dialogues.speaker: MATRE 'D
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, but no one used your reservation. Gentry considers what this means as streams of people sur and flex about him. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Telephone?

dialogues.speaker: MATRE 'D
dialogues.text: In the alcove, sir. There. Gentry courses through the crowd to a phone alcove near t restrooms, finds a coin, dials. The phone begins to ring. No answer. The ringing drones on.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR BEACH HOUSE
dialogues.text: The house lights are on. Buttermilk looks up from a nap t take in the phone. It rings on.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR ALEXANDER'S RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: Gentry slowly removes the receiver from his ear, lowers i into its cradle. The ringing stops. Finally. Gentry pivot and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry. Alone. Two shot glasses in front of him. Both empty. The bartender brings another. Fills it. Gentry empties it.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night crew is working. Two guys bored to hell. Playin catch with a softball across the room. Gentry enters. Tired. Mind-fucked. His briefcase is where he left it. So is the picture. Gentry looks at it. Nearby on the table is a small pile of pink phone message notes. To Gentry. From Adrienne. As the softball sails across the room, landing phlatt! ag and again in a mitt, Gentry stares at the sketch. A decis has to be made, but he's reluctant to make it. Finally Gentry stands, checks that his service revolver is loaded then makes for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading a magazine, Adrienne reclines on her bed stroking Buttermilk, her cat, who lies nearby. A sound. From downstairs. Adrienne freezes. Another sound A repeat of the night Douglas was killed. Adrienne stands moves reluctantly for the door.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRS
dialogues.text: pauses at the top of the staircase and listens. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete, is that you? Nothing. Adrienne pivots to return to the bedroom when another noise sounds below.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete? No response. Buttermilk slides past her and down the stai She kneels and reaches out for the animal.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Buttermilk. Don't go down there. But the cat is lost to the darkness. Adrienne stands, considers retreat. Again:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete, I tried to call... When there's no answer, she withdraws.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 78.

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: Adrienne returns. With the .357 Magnum revolver that chew up her husband. She follows its barrel's descent down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: stops at the base of the stairs and listens. A snap and a whoosh cause her to pivot and see Buttermilk near the dra She takes a deep breath and sweeps her eyes across the ro the gun barrel following, before realizing that the slidi door to the deck is OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (trembling) Pete, if this is your idea of a practical joke, it isn't funny. A form takes shape in the shadows outside. Adrienne gasps and staggers back several steps, swinging the gun about crazily, half out of control. The shadowy form moves clos entering the house. Adrienne continues to retreat, every breath threatening to seize control of her. The figure approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (sobbing) This gun is loaded! I'11l shoot! I'll shoot, damn it! Gentry steps into the light. The shadow figure. He stares at her with angry, murderous eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete! (recovering) Pete! Damn it, I could have killed you! (surging into his arms) I could have killed you! But he doesn't reciprocate her affection. She draws away, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: What's wrong? What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You know what's wrong. You know better than I do. You've always known better than I do.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 79.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I don't know what that means. Tell me what that means.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Where were you tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: The rental car has a dead battery. I tried to call. A movement beyond the plate glass door. Almost nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Another lie... The truth starts with this: You murdered your husband in cold blood.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (gasping) No!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You murdered Fenady when you thought he could identify you.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No, Pete! You know I didn't! Marta -- !

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Marta doesn't exist! You created her to mislead the police! The movement becomes a person. Closer.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: She exists! She wants to kill me!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You tried to murder me. You rigged the car, didn't you? The intruder is a woman. She could be... Adrienne, but sh isn't.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: And tonight you murdered an old man because he could identify you!  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 80.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete, this is crazy! This is crazy, I -- But Gentry grasps her, holding her eye-to-eye. A moment later he takes her gun.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You're finished lying, Mrs. Ericksen! Marta brings a weapon up. She aims it at Adrienne, not Gentry. Focused on each other, neither Gentry nor Adrienne have s Marta until this moment. Gentry leaps across the darkness knocking Adrienne to the ground as muzzleflash after muzzleflash explode in the darkness. By the time Gentry is on his feet, the woman has disappea He finds Adrienne.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Yes!... Marta! Gentry bolts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry rockets around the side of the house and past his Porsche to the street. He sees tail-lights flash down the block before tires screech and the car accelerates away. Gentry lowers his weapon and turns, almost colliding with Adrienne. The distance between them is nothing, and it is immense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing red lights from the roofs of several police blac and-whites bathe the area in undulating waves of crimson. Gentry talks to two uniformed officers; Leon leans agains nearby car, listening.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: -- see if anyone can give us the license plate number.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 81.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Sarge, it's pretty late...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I don't care. The car was parked a hundred yards north of here, but it may haven been in the neighborhood for hours. The assailant was probably waiting for the right moment to act. Any questions? No. The moment Gentry's finished with the blue suits, he turns and catches Leon's look. Gentry moves toward the house. Leon stops him.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Looks like you were right.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: She's innocent. You were right. I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. It happens. Gentry moves for the walkway. Leon watches him go. Concerned. A moment later Leon follows Gentry and sees him enter the house. He continues past the door, around to the front fr where Gentry and Adrienne's assailant made her getaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry closes the door behind him. He sees Adrienne sitti on the couch. Alone. Unmoving. Looking out the window at the darkness and the sea. Gentry moves to her.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Let me get you a drink. But she has a cup in her lap. Still full.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. Thanks. Cold. Distant. Her eyes remain at sea.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 82. Gentry studies her a long while before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I was wrong. The admission elicits nothing from Addie. Her mind is far away.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I... thought I had enough reasons--

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: How could you sleep with me and believe I was a... murderer? Gentry is startled by the question and the look of intens anger etched into her features.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Addie, I --

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: How could you make love to me... (angry and tearful) and believe that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon stands just outside the window. He sees Gentry and Adrienne talking and can barely hear the conversation. Pulling a penlight from a jacket pocket, Leon squats with Oomph! and trails the penlight across the sand.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Jesus, I'm getting too old for this shit... Even from here, he can hear snippets of Gentry and Adrien conversation between the crashing of waves.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I said I was wrong. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: But how could you believe that, Pete? Don't you know me? Don't you know who I am by now? Leon's penlight beam is picking up nothing but sand and a myriad of footprints. He sees something and reaches for i

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I know who you are, Addie.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 83. Leon pulls a pair of swimming trunks from the sand. Nearb something that looks like an opaque balloon. He reaches f that too, until he realizes what it is and throws it into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Shit! Shit! Probably got AIDS from the fucking thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne is at the door now, but continues to look out at night. Gentry stands across the room. Distance between them. He realizes that it is insurmountable. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I know you don't want me to stay here, but I'm going to arrange for around-the-clock police surveillance. You'll be okay. When she doesn't respond Gentry moves for the door. It's open and he's halfway through it when she spins.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete! Gentry stops. She's too far away and obscured by shadow f him to see her expression. He walks toward her. Halfway there he sees the tears in her eyes. He continues until their bodies unite. He pulls her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon stands up and sees Adrienne as she is swallowed by Gentry's arms. He spins her around. Her eyes open. On Leon. For a long moment they look at one another. Then he eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: taps several times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry pulls his service revolver and goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: LEON'S VOICE
dialogues.text: It's me.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 84. Gentry opens the door and Leon leans in. He makes brief e contact with Adrienne across the room, but she turns away immediately.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Look, I forgot to tell you. I had a call in to the DMV. They left a message with Metzger and he called it in to my answering machine. (fishing paper out of pocket) Ericksen's car was sold two months ago by a used car lot in Santa Monica. (shrugs ) It's the only lead we got.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I'll be out in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Right. Leon exits. Gentry takes in Adrienne across the room. Buttermilk has curled up in her lap and she pets the cat gently. Gentry sits on the arm of the couch beside her.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Leon and I are going to check out a lead. In the meantime, the safest thing is for you to accept police protection and go to a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: This is my home. I'm not going to be forced out. Not by her. Buttermilk stretches, then wanders off.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What about police protection?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: If you think it's necessary. Gentry takes her hands in his.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It's necessary... Addie, you know what you mean to me.... but you've got to understand I'm a cop, too. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deceptions by Richard Taylor 85. GENTRY (cont'd) It's what I do; it's what I am. I can't stop being a cop just because I'm nuts for you.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: All I ask is that you believe me, Pete.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry exits to find Leon waiting in his unmarked police unit.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I've got a call in for a unit. Gentry lights a cigaret, leans against the car. A moment later a black-and-white pulls into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: One of you guys cover the beach side. Clear everyone.

dialogues.speaker: PATROL OFFICER
dialogues.text: Right. Gentry slides into Leon's unit and it pulls away as the uniformed cops exit their black-and-white, stretch, move their assigned positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry and Leon lean on a late-model 'vette as a new Olds sedan pulls into the lot. A passing mechanic notes:

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: That's him. Gentry and Leon follow the car.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE ON THE USED CAR LOT
dialogues.text: a tall, thin man, SALESMAN, slides out of the Olds as Gen and Leon approach. Gentry shows him his police ID.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Police officers.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: (wary) Yeah?...  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 86.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: We're trying to trace down a car you reported selling two months ago.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: The buyer didn't re-register it, right?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, that happens a lot. C'mon, I'll look it up for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesman thumbs through files in a cabinet drawer usi slip of paper Leon gave him as a guide.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Here it is... Blue '87 Chrysler. Sold it June 9th. Paid cash.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: To a woman?

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: (surprised) No. Man. Gentry and Leon share a look. Gentry takes a wallet-size photo of Ericksen from his pocket, hands it to the Salesm

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: This the guy? The Salesman looks at the picture an instant before:

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: No... The guy who bought this car was maybe thirty, smaller. You know, not as beafy-looking.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Got a name?

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: I got the whole nine yards, but the guy didn't register the car, it's probably bullshit.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 87.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: We'll take it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: (reading file) Beavis. Steven Beavis. 12386 King's Road, West Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: We'll need a Xerox of that purchase contract, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry and Leon pacing toward their car.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll give you three scenarios. One: An uninvolved party bought the car for his own reasons and later turned it over to Ericksen. Two: Ericksen paid someone to buy it for him. Three: Marta has a boy friend and once Mrs. Ericksen was out of the way, they planned to kill Ericksen for his money.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (determined) Fuck scenarios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon's unmarked police unit pulls to the curb before a va lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry behind the wheel. Leon checks the address against their Xerox of the purchase contract.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Yeah. This should be the place. Gentry curses beneath his breath and puts the car into motion. All business. Focused. Leon studies him. Concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry on the phone. Leon sits nearby studying the car purchase contract.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 88.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (phone) She doesn't want to leave the house, Captain... Yeah, I know, but at least we could... Manpower shortage, sure, but... Yes, sir. I understand. Gentry slams the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: The fuck I do!

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: What is it? Rising and pulling on his coat:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: They're yanking our protective surveillance. I'm getting her out of that house. You coming?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: No. Think I'll check out the rest of this. He gestures at the contract.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It's a dead end. Gentry moves for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, even good liars can't lie all the time... Hey, Gentry! Gentry turns at the door and gives Leon a look that asks, What?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Keep your fly zipped, okay? Gentry gives him a gruff look and exits. Leon gives the purchase contract a glance, then pulls it closer for yet another read.

dialogues.speaker: PURCHASE CONTRACT
dialogues.text: Leon's finger traces down its middle, stopping for the briefest moment on the line that asks Occupation?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 89. The word Actor has been penciled in. Leon's finger return to the line.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME LEON
dialogues.text: as he thinks about it before picking up the phone to dial

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHIL CLAYBORNE, late 40s, balding but otherwise youthful- looking, moves up the counter and answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: (phone) Larry Edmonds Book Store. This is Phil Clayborne.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Phil, Leon Kessler. I'm looking for an actor. Maybe a stage guy. You still doing equity waiver theater?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Sure. What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Steven Beavis. Phil barks a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Beavis isn't an actor! He's a part! A character in a play! Leon is stunned. Expecting nothing, he's drawn a somethin but what? Then:

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Which play?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Velasco's Impertinence In Hell.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Where's it playing?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Not anywhere now. It closed at The Actor's Craft Theater a couple of months back, I think...  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 90.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME LEON
dialogues.text: as he slams the phone down in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Thank you, God! Thank you God for another smart ass! In absolute glee Leon grabs his coat and heads for the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's Porsche pulls in beside a black-and-white. A uniformed officer leans against his unit.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You guys get the call yet?

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
dialogues.text: Yeah. My partner's inside telling the woman. Gentry moves for the house, passing another uniformed cop the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry enters.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Addie? No answer. Gentry moves for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Addie?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Out here. Gentry heads for the sliding door leading to the outside deck. EXT. ERICKSEN DECK ‚Äî- DAY Addie leans against the rail and turns to face Gentry as approaches. The shorts and sweater she's wearing contrast the .357 that rests on the rail beside her.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete, what's going on? That policeman said they were leaving.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 91.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It's bureaucratic bullshit. The department won't allocate men for protective surveillance. I want you to go pack a bag and I'm going to take you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete, I already told you --

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: (forcefully) Just do it. Adrienne searches his eyes and finds steel. She turns and enters the house. Gentry follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrienne gets several small suitcases from the closet, op them on the bed. She begins packing as Gentry watches fro the doorway. After a moment she stops, straightens.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Jesus, Pete... I'm so scared... Gentry crosses the room and takes her into his arms. Ericksen's dried blood stains the floor nearby. Neither notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 99-seat pill box on Cahuenga Boulevard West. Leon's unmarked unit pulls up outside. He exits and moves for th the marquee, which displays the current production and ca An arrow sign suggests he go around to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon enters the lobby. 8x10 glossies adorn the walls. Pas productions. Past "Stars." No one we'd know. The place appears vacant. Then hammering from beyond a curtain.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Hey! Anybody here? Voices from beyond the curtain. Then a woman in her late emerges through the veil.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 92.

dialogues.speaker: THEATER MANAGER
dialogues.text: Yeah, can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Maybe. I'm looking for an actor.

dialogues.speaker: THEATER MANAGER
dialogues.text: (grin) Actors we got. Are you a casting agent or a producer?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You had a production of Impertinence in Hell a couple of months back. I need the name of the actor who played Steven Beavis.

dialogues.speaker: THEATER MANAGER
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Paul Basque. He's good.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Can I see a picture? The Theater Manager pulls a photo album from beneath the counter.

dialogues.speaker: THEATER MANAGER
dialogues.text: (thumbing) Sure. We keep all of the production stills. And of course the actors leave a supply of their 8xl0s... Here it is. She spins the photo album around. Leon looks. A half doze actors in contemporary dress in front of an amateurish ba drop. Young. Good looking.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Which one is he?

dialogues.speaker: THEATER MANAGER
dialogues.text: There. On the end. Paul Basque. Lean. Dark. Otherwise a nonentity.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Good. I'll need a photograph I can keep.

dialogues.speaker: THEATER MANAGER
dialogues.text: Sure. I'll get you an 8x10 anda resume. Just take a second.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 93.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Thanks. The moment she's gone, Leon again peruses the production still before leafing through the book. He stops at one photo. Private Lives, the caption reads. Two couples. Again, Paul Basque. Leon's vision trails across to the wo beside Basque in the picture. He freezes.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. The woman is... Adrienne. Or her dead ringer, Marta! Leon rips the photo free and rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry ties two suitcases to the rack on the rear of his Porsche. Adrienne slips into the passenger seat, Gentry behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leon on the phone. Hearing ring after ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is vacant. The phone rings incessantly.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME LEON
dialogues.text: as he stabs the disconnect bar, then dials another number

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: (phone) This is Kessler. Has Gentry returned?... Has he called in?... Okay, page him. When he calls, give him this number. 555-7125. Tell him it's an emergency. I'm standing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's belt pager sounds. He twists to turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You want to stop and see what that's about?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 94.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It can wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open and the bellboy enters with Adrienne bags. Gentry and Adrienne follow. The bellboy places the bags on the bed stand, pulls open the drapes, presents himself for a tip and exits once Gentry hands him a bill. The moment he's gone:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Okay, I want you to stay in this room. Call room service for food. Don't go outside. Not for anything. Understood? Adrienne's eyes sweep across her prison, then take in Gen She nods assent.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Do you have the gun? Adrienne opens her bag, takes out the .357 Magnum, return it. She tosses the bag to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Is it ever going to be over? Gentry takes her, holds her rigid. A long look, then he kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: We'll find her. You've just got to hang in there.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (small smile) I'm hanging.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: I'll be back tonight. Late. I'll call first. Gentry kisses her once more, and then he leaves. Adrienne locks the door and gives the room a long, bored pan. At the window, Adrienne sees Gentry exit the hotel and mo for his car. The beat-up Porsche thunders out of the park lot. Adrienne's eyes sweep the surroundings outside, stop on... a cat being fed by one of the hotel workers.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 95.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Buttermilk! Adrienne picks up the phone and taps the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: This is Four-Seventeen. I'm going to need a cab...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry's Porsche powers up the hill to Santa Monica and e toward the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi pulls into the driveway and Adrienne gets out. She pays the cabbie and he drives away.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR ERICKSEN HOUSE
dialogues.text: Adrienne opens the door to the dark house and enters, clo the door behind her. She snaps on a light in the kitchen which spills shadows into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Buttermilk? Buttermilk?... Adrienne searchs the living room for a moment before Buttermilk strolls out from behind the couch and into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: There you are! Adrienne pets Buttermilk a moment before a shadow from th kitchen light crawls across her. Startled, Adrienne spins to find Leon standing just inside the door. Tense and fearful, Adrienne almost whispers:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Detective Kessler! You startled me! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ericksen, I found out some very interesting things about you today.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Oh? Like what?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 96. Leon pulls the folded production still from his pocket an holds it up for her to see.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Your thespian background, for one thing.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I used to act, yes.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You used to act with Paul Basque. You remember him, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Paul purchased the car your husband supposedly used the night he tried to kill you. Know what that suggests to me, Mrs. Ericksen?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: No. What's that?

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Gotcha!... There aint no Marta and there never was.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You and Paul Basque killed your husband for the insurance. He bought the car as a ruse. You've been lovers since you performed together. (a grin) On the stage, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You're mistaken, Detective. Paul Basque was a friend of my husband's. He was the one who introduced us. Leon's expression reveals that his neat package may be falling apart. An explosion, Marta leaps from the shadows where she's be hiding, and yelling like a madwoman, plunges a knife deep into Leon's chest as Adrienne screams.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 97. Leon staggers back, already falling into the abyss of sho as he stares at Marta. Gurgling, Leon drops to the carpet Adrienne's screams continue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is almost deserted as the last of the day crew wander out. Gentry enters and moves for his work area. He corrals FELDMAN, another detective.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Any messages?

dialogues.speaker: FELDMAN
dialogues.text: It's all there in your basket. Leon was trying to get in touch with you earlier, and there've been a couple of calls from some woman. Gentry finds his pile of messages and shuffles through th One makes him stop. Adrienne Another. Two more. Four in all. Gentry checks the times. Last half hour or so. The phone rings. Gentry almost leaps for it.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Homicide. Sergeant Gentry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is pitch-black. Adrienne's sweaty, tension-draw face can be seen by moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (phone) Pete?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Addie, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Pete... Marta!...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What? What is it? What about Marta?  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 98.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: She's here! At the beach house, Pete! She's -- ! But Marta grabs the phone from Adrienne.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill the bitch!... Unless you do exactly as I say! Marta shoves the phone back into Adrienne's face. Adrienn is sobbing now. She's almost insane with fear.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Tell him!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: She wants the money! If you... If you'll come here and don't bring the police, she'll trade me for the money tomorrow. She wants you to go pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: (shrill) Come here! Now! And no cops! Tomorrow you get her and I get the money. That's the deal!

dialogues.speaker: RESUME GENTRY
dialogues.text: as he hears a click. The phone remains in his hand when t out-of-service tone comes on. Across the room, Feldman is just now moving for the door.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Feldman! Feldman stops, surprised by Gentry's outburst.

dialogues.speaker: FELDMAN
dialogues.text: What is it, Pete? Gentry wrestles with it a long moment before:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Nothing. ‚ÄòNight. See you tomorrow.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 99.

dialogues.speaker: FELDMAN
dialogues.text: (curious) Sure. Tomorrow... Is anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: No. Nothing. Gentry surges past him and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry drives with passionate abandon. His steely eyes ar fixed on the road ahead and farther, the beach house and waits for him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche screeches to a stop at the edge of a dune, du billowing behind it. Gentry leaps free of the car, pops t front trunk, pulls out a suitcase. Removing his jacket, Gentry pulls shirts and slacks from the case and tosses t aside until he finds a dark turtle-neck sweater and pulls on. From a crumpled sack on the passenger seat Gentry takes a of black shoe polish and spreads it across cheek and brow moment later he's pulled a knit cap over his hair and ear He tapes a knife to one calf. Looking like a commando now, Gentry moves for the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry pauses near the surf. The house is completely dark He makes for it.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE DECK
dialogues.text: pauses and listens. The roar of the sea drowns everything Creeping closer, Gentry sees movement at the window, a br formless shape passing in the moonlight. Gentry flattens onto the deck and rests, cheek-to-board, a long moment. Then, like a snake, he crawls toward the glass door. Inches from the glass, Gentry looks inside.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surreal scene: Leon sits in one chair. Leon's corpse is out of Gentry's line-of-sight. Adrienne sits absolutely still on the couch. She might be dead herself... until her eyes betray a look at the glass and the sea beyond. Can she see Gentry? A form in near shadow. A gun in its hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry brings his weapon up and waits for the shadow to become a target. It denies him. The shadow flits to anoth darkness, this nebula behind Adrienne, whose body shields Suppressing a curse, Gentry slowly returns the gun to his belt and retreats from the glass. At the deck's edge, Gentry rolls to the sand and makes hi way along the front of the house to the side walkway. At the side door, Gentry drops to his knees and maneuvers below the window-line past the entrance. Gentry ascends the wall of the garage to the second floor then up to the master bedroom window. A moment later, he' inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentry turns from the window and knocks a lamp from its perch, catching it inches from the floor. A moment later he's at the door. Like the night of Dougla Ericksen's death, the door squeaks as it is pulled open. From below:

dialogues.speaker: MARTA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: What was that?! Half through the doorway, Gentry listens to:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: What? I didn't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: A noise. From the stairs. No choice now. He continues through.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 101.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRS
dialogues.text: pulls his service revolver and moves with stealth to the of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: It's nothing. It's probably my cat, Buttermilk.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: (rough) We're going to check it out anyway! Gentry assumes a firing position with the revolver pointe downward into the well of darkness. He hears footsteps... and then the meow of a cat as it prances across the thres of the stairs below. Adrienne, having just moved into moonlight, picks up the

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: See? I told you. It was just Buttermilk.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Come on. Back over here. Adrienne turns. Her eyes trail upward. She sees Gentry. Their eyes lock. She continues to pet the cat automatical before:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: It's all right, Buttermilk. It's all right. Holding the cat to her cheek, Adrienne turns and does wha Marta has told her to do. Gentry descends the steps. One at a time. Slowly. Each foot-fall measured to deny noise. The gun held out and aimed, prepared to fire. Voices. Marta's. Adrienne's. Words lost to the hiss of Gentry's breathing. Sweat casca from his brow, sweat and shoe polish dripping to the carp Still he moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: reaches the base of the stairs. He sees Adrienne sitting before the window still petting the cat. Across from her another form, obscured by darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: He's not coming.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 102.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: The hell he's not.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: This isn't going to work.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You better hope it does. Gentry moves forward until he's mere feet from the sittin form obscured by darkness. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Freeze! Don't move! The silence is deafening. No motion at all. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Adrienne, turn on a light. Adrienne stands, moves to the end of the couch, reaches o and switches the lamp on. Gentry stares down the barrel of his cocked gun at... Leo corpse. Stunned, he cannot move.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: He's dead, Pete. A mindless reaction, Gentry pivots to face Marta who stan across the room, her weapon aimed at Adrienne.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Drop it! Or I'll kill her! Adrienne stands between them, an easy target. Gentry lowe his weapon, drops it. Marta moves forward, gestures Gentry to move back, takes weapon he dropped on the floor. The moment the gun is in Marta's possession, Adrienne steps forward and kisses Mar lustily. Adrienne pulls back and grins at Gentry, who stands mute.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: So tell me, darling... what kind of fuck is he?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Not bad, actually. Not as good as you, but not bad at all.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 103.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Lots of enthusiasm, I imagine...

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: (appraising Gentry) Yes, that's one way to put it. They see Gentry's dumb-struck look and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You'd better tell him, or he's liable to have a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Can't have that, can we? Too early. Marta reaches up and pulls the wig off. "Marta" becomes P Basque before our eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA/PAUL
dialogues.text: So you see, we're not perverse killers, Sergeant Gentry, just the normal kind. Heterosexual, that is. Sit down. (to Adrienne) Bring me my clothes. Adrienne ascends the stairs to the bedroom as Gentry sits beside Leon, who topples onto him. Gentry catches the cor of his friend and, as if realizing that he's dead for the first time, gently lowers Leon to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: A casualty of poor planning, your friend. Gentry's look of anger and hatred surprises even Paul.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Don't get any ideas. I enjoy killing. It's more fun than anything except... (grin) +. stealing that extra bow. Adrienne returns with Paul's clothes. He gives her Gentry gun. She trains it on Gentry.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Don't kill him unless you have to. Paul removes the blouse and padded bra.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 104.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Sergeant Gentry, we're going to make a little deal. The honest truth is, we bungled the job. We thought we'd planned an air-tight murder, but as you well know, it started to unravel almost immediately. The skirt drops to the floor, revealing pantihose and ben them, jockey shorts. He kicks off the heels, sits to remo the pantihose. Naked but shirt.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Now it doesn't matter if we kill you or not; your successor will come to the same conclusions you would have come to, which is that Adrienne and an accomplice killed her husband for his money. So... we have to get rid of Adrienne Ericksen, too.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: What makes you think you're getting any better at this? for the jockey shorts, Paul pulls on jeans and a t-

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: This is the "you can't get away with it" speech. Save it. If we get caught now, we both fry and we know it... There are a number of witnesses who saw a woman matching "Marta's" description accompany Adrienne Ericksen this afternoon as she withdrew two million dollars in insurance money from her account. Tomorrow or the next day someone's going to find Detective Kessler's body there.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: Or maybe they'll find mine. Paul stops for only a moment before using a garment to wi make-up from his face. He grins.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 105.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Or maybe they'll find yours, out in the desert where you chased Marta and her prisoner and she killed you in a fire-fight. Dressed now, Paul gathers up his "Marta" clothes and ties them together with a belt.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: They'll also find lots of blood in Adrienne's car. Adrienne's blood. She's already donated it. It's in the fridge... They'll assume the worst. Adrienne's dead. Officers Gentry and Kessler dead. And Marta a very wealthy psychopath.

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: It won't hold up. Somebody'11 break it wide.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. They'll look for a woman. As you can see, something I'm not. Dressed now, Paul returns and gestures for Adrienne to gi him her weapon. The moment she does Gentry dives for the endtable lamp. Paul fires, hitting Gentry as he flies acr the couch and behind, the light dying behind him.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Out of the way! Paul pushes Adrienne toward the glass door and fires thre times, each round providing a flash of illumination. Gentry, behind the couch, yanks the knife free from where taped it to his calf and crawls away from the flashes.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Turn on the lights! Turn on the lights! Paul almost topples over a table before he reaches the wa where the light switch is located. The light flashes on.. to disclose Gentry standing across the room, waiting. The moment Paul turns Gentry's knife thuds into his chest and drops already dead to the floor. Gentry and Adrienne stand across the room from one anothe Gentry defenseless, Adrienne still armed with a handgun.  Deceptions by Richard Taylor 106. He hobbles toward her, the red stain on the left side of ribcage widening as he moves. Adrienne brings the pistol Gentry continues. She cocks the weapon. Gentry gets close Her finger tenses. Closer. Finger squeezing. Closer. She lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I never wanted to hurt you, Pete. I love you. Paul made me do it. He was crazy. I was afraid of him. Afraid that if I didn't -- He takes the gun from her.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: I have the money. We can figure something out, can't we? Something to explain all this? Because I love you, Pete. We can be rich and we can be together. Gentry is in tremendous pain. Blood seeps out of him. He blinks to retain consciousness. And there's more. After everything she's done, there remains in Gentry feeling fo Adrienne. Adrienne looks up into his eyes. Her beauty is exquisite.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: We can think of something to say...

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in court... Gentry staggers back to the phone, gets a dial tone, taps three numbers. As he dials:

dialogues.speaker: GENTRY
dialogues.text: You have the right to an attorney. If you can't afford an attorney, one will be provided for you. (phone) This is Sergeant Gentry, LAPD...
